intro: Osbeckia zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon osbeckia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including Sri Lanka, India, and parts of Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a pubescent surface. The flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters, and are characterized by their tubular corolla with five lobes.
